skill.name: umap-learn
skill.description: UMAP dimensionality reduction. Fast nonlinear manifold learning for 2D/3D visualization, clustering preprocessing (HDBSCAN), supervised/parametric UMAP, for high-dimensional data.
skill.summary: UMAP dimensionality reduction. Fast nonlinear manifold learning for 2D/3D visualization, clustering ...
skill.author: K-Dense-AI

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only markdown files and JSON metadata. No executable code, no file system access, no network calls, no command execution. The skill provides UMAP library documentation for AI assistants.

content.value_statement: High-dimensional datasets are difficult to explore and understand. This skill provides UMAP dimensionality reduction techniques to transform complex data into 2D/3D visualizations that reveal hidden patterns and cluster structures.
actual_capabilities: Create 2D and 3D visualizations from high-dimensional data using UMAP nonlinear dimensionality reduction
Preprocess data for clustering algorithms like HDBSCAN with optimized UMAP parameters
Apply supervised UMAP using label information for guided dimensionality reduction
Use parametric UMAP with TensorFlow/Keras for efficient transformation of new data
Implement AlignedUMAP for analyzing temporal or batch datasets
Configure distance metrics including euclidean, cosine, and hamming for different data types
limitations: Computational complexity scales with data size; large datasets may require significant processing time
Non-deterministic results without fixed random_state; embeddings vary between runs
Does not preserve global structure as reliably as local structure across different datasets

use_cases.title: Visualize Complex Datasets
use_cases.description: Transform high-dimensional data into 2D scatter plots that reveal cluster structure and relationships.

use_cases.title: Analyze Single-Cell Data
use_cases.description: Visualize single-cell RNA-seq and other omics data to identify cell populations and subtypes.

use_cases.title: Feature Engineering
use_cases.description: Reduce feature dimensions before clustering to improve density-based clustering accuracy.

prompt_templates.title: Quick Start
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the umap-learn skill to show me how to install umap-learn and create a basic 2D embedding from my data.

prompt_templates.title: Clustering Setup
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me how to configure UMAP parameters for optimal clustering preprocessing with HDBSCAN.

prompt_templates.title: Labeled Data
prompt_templates.prompt: Explain supervised UMAP and show how to use labels to guide the embedding process for class separation.

prompt_templates.title: Image Analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: How do I use UMAP to visualize image embeddings from a CNN or vision model?

output_examples.input: Show me how to use UMAP for clustering preprocessing
output: For clustering, configure UMAP with higher n_neighbors (30) and min_dist (0.0) to create dense clusters.
Use n_components=5-10 instead of 2 to preserve more density information.
Then apply HDBSCAN on the reduced embedding for density-based clustering.

best_practices: Always standardize features with StandardScaler before applying UMAP to ensure equal weighting.
Set random_state for reproducibility; results vary without fixed seed.
Start with default parameters (n_neighbors=15, min_dist=0.1) and tune based on visualization quality.
anti_patterns: Applying UMAP without preprocessing data; unscaled features create biased embeddings.
Using the same parameters for visualization and clustering; different goals need different settings.
Expecting UMAP to preserve exact global distances; it optimizes local neighborhood structure.

faq.question: What Python version does umap-learn support?
faq.answer: umap-learn requires Python 3.8 or later and works with NumPy, SciPy, and Numba.

faq.question: What is the maximum data size for UMAP?
faq.answer: Performance depends on memory; start with samples under 100,000 for reasonable runtimes.

faq.question: How do I integrate UMAP with scikit-learn pipelines?
faq.answer: UMAP follows scikit-learn conventions; use it in pipelines with StandardScaler and classifiers.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using UMAP?
faq.answer: UMAP runs locally on your machine; no data is sent to external servers.

faq.question: Why are my results different each time?
faq.answer: UMAP uses stochastic optimization; set random_state parameter for reproducibility.

faq.question: How does UMAP compare to t-SNE?
faq.answer: UMAP is faster, preserves more global structure, and scales better to higher dimensions.
